headline: 2025-10-28 — arXiv.org preprint authors (power-interactions paper) ran a simulation using 1 RLC circuit to illustrate and validate the proposed interaction-variable framework (1 circuit). Evidence: “Without loss of generality, we utilize a simple RLC circuit with a controllable voltage source for illustrations.”

2025-10-29 — arXiv.org preprint authors (power-interactions paper) implemented intermediate reactive-power control as a command to the lower-layer physical model, specifying control in reactive power units (VAR) and offering two implementation methods (FBLC and SMC). Evidence: “The higher layer design utilizes the interactive energy state-space model to derive intermediate reactive power control, which becomes a control command to the lower layer physical model... implemented using either Feedback Linearizing Control (FBLC) or Sliding Mode Control (SMC).”

2025-10-30 — arXiv.org preprint authors (quadcopter paper) replaced Euler-angle based attitude feedback with quaternion state feedback, removing trigonometric parameters from the estimator (reduction = 100% of those trigonometric parameters). Evidence: “Hence, quaternion state feedback is utilized... The quaternion implementation also reduces the overall complexity of state estimation due to absence of trigonometric parameters.”
